title: Mortgage Rates Hit Fresh Three-Year High
sub_head: Rapid rise in borrowing costs come as Federal Reserve signals more interest-rate increases to tame inflation
body:
Home buyers and owners are facing the highest mortgage interest rates in three years, a rapid increase that threatens to cool down the red-hot housing market.
The average 30-year fixed mortgage rate rose to 4.42% this week, up more than a quarter percentage point from a week ago and more than a full point from the start of the year, according to mortgage company Freddie Mac . Other firms that track mortgage costs pegged the average rate even higher.
